E6829263E2534E20B42C60ECD5EBAD3C.description: Comment on the ways that meaning can be expressed verbally and non-verbally in different contexts.

7536A6B6EA3145C58E988F2F060BE77B.description: Begin to evaluate own and others' talk, including what went well and what could be improved next time.

2A77674E1D4243D3A69852B4877F099A.description: and deliver a presentation independently on a familiar subject in a familiar context.

22B0221118064B4981E9085A32969526.description: Plan and deliver a group presentation on a familiar subject, including to a wider audience.

2B8B3E86D8B04998ACD6B0C71A718176.description: Adapt speech, gesture and movement to portray a character in drama.

90BD3D3F59B447018B36C5F6E44CA84D.description: Read aloud with accuracy and fluency, showing awareness of punctuation.

CF40F1BBB3234A1FACB3829122659B0A.description: Read aloud with expression, adapting the pace and volume appropriate to the content.

A74C9C1E2BB0404FA9B536D2A659E6F6.description: Take turns in a discussion, making links with what others have said.

A5782C35E2774302AB38F60AA5A291BE.description: Extend a discussion by contributing relevant comments and questions.

5E188A59E17D457C9DF2CCABDB054603.description: Respond politely to another point of view with a personal point of view.

C9E0B8C93079435BA0BD75987E3C784A.description: Begin to take an assigned role within a group.

551CD1068C3E4647B95126B69BB8FEBA.description: Listen and respond appropriately, including asking and answering questions to develop ideas.

7B1CDA9AB39A4B69B262620E28037684.description: Show awareness of an audience, e.g. by adapting language and tone to engage them.

164383F32BC14A95A5C26E5C44ABB396.description: Use non-verbal communication techniques for different purposes.

E41DC3AC0C29453F871F76DB2D4343BD.description: Use vocabulary precisely to make the meaning clear.

7F99BDE454964B1C95350499814C6ABF.description: Sequence relevant information to aid the listener's understanding.

F8AFF7E6B69B4949816BD2FBD0B16DC8.description: Speak with accuracy and sometimes at length in a range of familiar contexts.

5EB39862678E4BC3A0B05BD3858BB3D6.description: Proofread for grammar, spelling and punctuation errors, and make corrections, including using on-screen tools.

89B12E8AF2AD4B30A49C7F5DAAF750E8.description: Evaluate own and others’ writing, suggesting improvements for sense, accuracy and content.

0059D212C85A4675AEA88F90E5218EAD.description: Explore and use different ways of laying out and presenting texts to suit the purpose and audience (handwritten, printed and onscreen).

18C3E6CCBF7F43C783F77E96989E3AA7.description: Make short notes to record information from a text and use them to inform writing.

358C3198A41D4C0EAE8999688D2A139C.description: Write legibly, fluently and with increasing speed.

C7ECD72B0C5945EA9C251F4F52A3D991.description: Adopt a viewpoint in non-fiction writing that is appropriate for the purpose and audience.

E3D9A46BF5434685810D776C4DF82FD3.description: Develop writing of a range of text types for a specified audience, using appropriate content and language.

2A3B88CC7BBF4C3C91336B04C55369ED.description: Develop writing for a purpose using language and features appropriate for a range of text types.

9A3EEDA5753D46DA9C6B1E93266C1AFB.description: Begin to express a viewpoint in fiction through a character's opinions about a setting or other characters.

76D367DFA083411FA20E254AAE513668.description: Write alternative beginnings and endings for stories.

412F44F181C34B2A8523761B6444D710.description: Develop descriptions of settings and characters to capture the reader's imagination.

E1E199ACB505478FAFA7A4ABB102E420.description: Write character profiles to inform story writing.

762EE6F6C8884DE687915458917483D9.description: Explore and use different ways of planning to inform writing for particular purposes.

F6B28061A6F845A9898710339E9A72A2.description: Develop creative writing in a range of different genres of fiction and types of poems.

882D847EABA74B46B6CC7DB23DF41B62.description: Use organisational features appropriate to the text type, e.g. bulleted and numbered lists.

B18D69AC07E148B68BD12B9F75E58C5D.description: Use connectives to establish links between paragraphs, e.g. if, although.

4AE692D445A34CC2B2BBF0FAD81234F4.description: Use paragraphs and sections consistently to organise ideas.

B1BC31DCA8B34CC7AF92782C60863E2C.description: Develop a logical sequence of ideas, making relationships between them clear.

CEA2A11DA51A438CB7947265C20F6E07.description: Use adverbs and adverbial phrases appropriately.

AA729C5648564238B815FEE464049CC1.description: Use a range of quantifiers appropriately for the context, e.g. either, neither, both.

FD59F70A07AB42D28CB203100B126735.description: Use the verb to be accurately, including subject-verb agreement for different verb forms.

D9A3C8A2A2154411BF1D9B61BF187F72.description: Experiment with varying verb forms in texts, including in direct speech.

A04BE59994284ED698213B74EABFEC0E.description: Use past, present and future verb forms accurately.

8D3EC831C5404BEE9F798D201A854601.description: Write multi-clause sentences using a range of connectives.

DA0BAE53F6D641618DCD54D38E10A3D6.description: Begin to use other punctuation alongside speech marks to punctuate direct speech.

90746A285FBC4F18B696C4A43B49415E.description: Use apostrophes for singular and plural possession.

F5F55B742D034BA1B7D019F9A466872A.description: Begin to use commas to make the meaning of sentences clearer.

A5ED2E5DA6324C6B923482063D959CCB.description: Use own lists of interesting and significant words, dictionaries and thesauruses to extend the range of vocabulary used in written work.

96FD2E89FD904823938396B4720FD16F.description: Use simple figurative language, including alliteration and similes.

A8A313B8384B40BE9D63588F9891C876.description: Choose and use words (including verbs, e.g. rushed instead of went) to strengthen the impact of writing.

DB84B7A3874D450BA1C64851E479184A.description: Explore shades of meaning in adjectives and adverbs (e.g. tepid, warm, hot), and use them appropriately in own writing.

32CD3B32D79A4DE38D05670B39FD9801.description: Explore and use alternatives for overused words and phrases.

DAA84E1C866047CD955135759B462BF5.description: Use specialised vocabulary accurately to match a familiar topic.

58A22F67F86D47D7ABF29A4F48C179CC.description: Use paper-based and on-screen tools to find the correct spelling of words; keep and use spelling logs of misspelt words, and identify words that need to be learned.

8E925CFFEDBD4168A382A94900979DD0.description: Use effective strategies, including segmenting, spelling rules, visual memory and mnemonics, to spell a range of unfamiliar regular and exception words correctly.

D9A7E74B712F428F9C4AF8173265B686.description: Generate spelling rules from spelling patterns, and test them.

44A66B3B3EAB4E44AD32D8F59597726F.description: Spell words with common letter strings but different pronunciations, e.g. tough, through, trough, plough.

C6B9FF9C9E0F40D58BF037CDF32D6772.description: Spell common homophones correctly to match their grammatical purpose, including they’re, their, there.

2996A6BF83D1485C85FB2190121F7E03.description: Explore and build words with related roots and meanings, e.g. medical, medicine; sign, signal, signature.

2EA5BCB479A04C78B0C07E3168C4860B.description: Spell words with a range of common prefixes and suffixes, including trans-, pre-, -ion, -ation and -ous.

939049530EDF4535AA77E21612F42D28.description: Explore and use spelling patterns for pluralisation, including -s, -es, -y/-ies and -f/-ves.

D0D436CA0EF4411AA22E5AE4B1977132.description: Explore and use silent letters (e.g. knife, lamb) and different spellings of words with vowel phonemes (e.g. short vowel phonemes: umbrella, young and love ('o' before 'v'); long vowel phonemes after 'w': want, war, water, word).

13F2A47D32F04500B77A11F0D5B880BC.description: Comment on how fiction reflects the time or context in which it is set.

8C99E345C8754F07A0B074F74A947681.description: Develop preferences about favourite books and share recommendations with others.

FDCF113DA9794B81B26A9FAF86684252.description: Express personal responses to texts, including linking characters, settings and events to personal experience.

37AC1536802B4DA8A779EE1482F027A0.description: Enjoy independent and shared reading of fiction genres, poems, playscripts and non-fiction texts.

A046CFD7F76D4AE6A55E4E2A7282BA94.description: Identify the viewpoint from which a story is told.

29BF28132AEB43CEBE534F188B8E02E7.description: Recognise, compare and contrast the themes and features of texts.

D8969C4ED61D43A5B4CCDE8A1FE0DC10.description: Answer questions with some reference to single points in a text.

00623AABA0C844799F34AEDF5104CBEC.description: Locate and use relevant information from a text to answer questions.

2D64848B94CB49AFA8527AA30E35AA13.description: Skim to gain an overall sense of a text.

016AE5901BA1469C88048610EBEB0C25.description: Begin to distinguish between fact and opinion in texts.

5618C24004C74485A6045A6AEF9517DF.description: Make inferences from texts, including about story settings and characters.

ED097955F8594595A778FEACB94F6387.description: Predict what happens next in a story based on previous events in the story.

75C6E1092C774D70BC6E0ED082339DB8.description: Explore implicit meanings in a range of texts.

716C84BC8E8A4BCE96E656B7D949C863.description: Explain how settings and characters are developed, identifying key words and phrases from the story.

D230C7BE92844FB4A096BEBFF53ED1D1.description: Identify key words and phrases that establish the main points in a text.

71D85FA00F5D42ECB125E38B7DDFA8F0.description: Explore explicit meanings in a range of texts.

8911B9C5912F426DB3A392CA6FDCE135.description: Identify, discuss and compare the purposes and features of different non-fiction text types, including how texts persuade the reader.

8EEEF7126F574AA3A4B993FC87FE9FEA.description: Read and explore a range of non-fiction text types.

6E27113821F549AC8188730B877F0E51.description: Identify, discuss and compare different fiction genres and their typical characteristics.

1CB76B8F0A3147668D32533977AE6640.description: Read and explore a range of fiction genres, poems and playscripts, including identifying the contribution of any visual elements or multimedia.

EC2B82EC0366433CB623F948CE596B79.description: Understand the difference between fiction and non-fiction texts and locate books by classification.

9601633B1520402795021233D597FAFC.description: Explore and recognise how points are sequenced and linked to develop ideas within and between paragraphs.

6D83C042C9C04EA7B496F07A3CB37EB5.description: Explore and recognise how ideas are organised in paragraphs and sections.

4AB10E76FB034A528EF6BBBF11D54D34.description: Explore and recognise the key features of text structure in a range of different fiction and non-fiction texts, including poems and playscripts.

E791C63FECD64D57B5E39014CB785628.description: Explore and describe the main stages in a text from introduction to conclusion.

94833A796B06459E822723C6C47292E7.description: Explore in texts, and understand, subject-verb agreement.

440FACF5F3E843798F6330F60A5DE66A.description: Explore and understand how past, present and future verb forms are used in texts.

E60D6DF65DC64C0BB9B2B36954610B07.description: Explore in texts examples of adverbs and adverbial phrases, including their purposes.

8E8570C41D704D42A24D9846557CE50B.description: Explore in texts a range of examples of quantifiers, e.g. either, neither, both.

7A73901948234FDF940F419836E56841.description: Explore in texts the use of different connectives in multi-clause sentences.

E4119BB2D379425CB663D5BF4B4D1C1E.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the standard layout and punctuation of direct speech.

B955375ECA66447597ECC6549AC63BD3.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the use of commas and apostrophes.

24F0CDE422314901826135406AE8767F.description: Use knowledge of punctuation and grammar to read unfamiliar texts with understanding.

AC557925F4BD4C1C8A406C01068F774E.description: Comment on the impact of figurative language in texts, including alliteration and similes.

479F22C162704C7790E134CD1E17EF01.description: Identify and recognise meaning of figurative language in texts, including alliteration and similes, e.g. as … as …

8690A306E3BF4FF48D1E480680DB0EE8.description: Explore and comment on how a writer's choice of words, including adjectives and adverbs, enhances the meaning (shades of meaning).

3B4BE3C8B7024583943389DA179FAEFA.description: Explore and comment on how a writer's choice of words, including verbs, strengthens the impact on the reader, e.g. rushed instead of went.

ECAE5EE095184AB4B9B4DE51008343D1.description: Use as many initial letters as necessary to organise words in alphabetical order, and to locate words in dictionaries and glossaries.

968D5D450FE546209A75E8D17B077CB4.description: Identify and record interesting and significant words, and synonyms, from texts to inform own writing.

1B036F56974B472988AE4AF0EC1AC24B.description: Explore words with common roots and compare their meanings.

CBC111E6161D4C21B892923B84AAC644.description: Use context to suggest synonyms for unfamiliar words.

FF1FD6BD48EF45E78B27A88D72905718.description: Extend the range of common words recognised on sight, including homophones and near-homophones.

3686BA41A38C43B8A921B93FAB495F02.description: Identify stressed and unstressed syllables in multi-syllabic words.

A67414028D494542830282E32BCBDF18.description: Use effective strategies to read unfamiliar words accurately and confidently, including using phonic, morphological and grammatical knowledge, segmenting and contextual information.
